definitions: smooth continuous movement of liquid, air, or other substances in one direction
steady continuous stream or supply of something
examples: The river's flow was gentle after the spring rain
Traffic flow improved significantly after the new lanes opened
The company maintains a steady flow of new products
Information flow between departments needs better coordination

definitions: unit of measurement for the amount of energy that food provides
examples: This apple contains about eighty calories of energy
She tracks her daily calorie intake using an app

definitions: small hard part produced by plants from which new plants grow
beginning or source from which something develops
examples: Plant the tomato seeds about an inch deep
She collected seeds from her garden for next year
His childhood experiences planted seeds of entrepreneurship
The research provided seeds for future innovations

definitions: short form of bicycle, a two-wheeled vehicle powered by pedaling
examples: She rides her bike to work every morning
The kids left their bikes in the garage

definitions: person or organization that pays people to work for them
examples: Her employer offers excellent health insurance benefits
The company is the largest employer in town

definitions: sudden event causing great damage, loss, or destruction
complete failure or very bad result
examples: The earthquake was the worst disaster in decades
Emergency teams responded quickly to the natural disaster
The party turned into a complete disaster
His first attempt at cooking was a disaster

definitions: act of selling something or being sold
period when goods are sold at reduced prices
examples: The sale of the house completed last Friday
Car sales increased significantly this quarter
The department store's annual sale starts tomorrow
I bought these shoes on sale for half price

definitions: room containing a toilet and usually a sink and bathtub
examples: The bathroom is down the hall on your left
We're renovating the master bathroom this summer

definitions: list of items to be discussed at a meeting
underlying often hidden plan or intention
examples: The meeting agenda includes budget discussions and updates
Please add that topic to tomorrow's agenda
Critics claim the policy has a political agenda
She wondered what his real agenda might be

definitions: act of making people obey laws, rules, or regulations
examples: Law enforcement officers patrol the neighborhood regularly
Stricter enforcement of safety regulations is needed

definitions: kinds of food that a person regularly eats
special course of food to lose weight or for medical reasons
examples: A balanced diet includes fruits and vegetables daily
The Mediterranean diet emphasizes olive oil and fish
She started a new diet to lower cholesterol
The doctor prescribed a low-sodium diet

definitions: small area on a surface with different color or texture
number or letter showing quality of work
examples: There's a dark mark on the kitchen table
The accident left permanent marks on the car
She received high marks in all her exams
The teacher gave full marks for creativity

definitions: complete absence of sound or noise
examples: The library demands complete silence during study hours
An uncomfortable silence filled the room after his comment

definitions: person who writes news stories for newspapers, magazines, or broadcasts
examples: The journalist interviewed witnesses at the scene
She works as a freelance journalist covering technology

definitions: sacred book of Christianity containing Old and New Testaments
book regarded as authoritative in its field
examples: She reads a chapter from the Bible every morning
The church distributed free Bibles to newcomers
This cookbook is considered the bible of French cuisine
The manual became the programmer's bible

definitions: female ruler of a country or wife of a king
most powerful piece in chess
examples: The queen addressed the nation on television
Queen Elizabeth ruled for over seventy years
She moved her queen to protect the king
The chess queen can move in any direction

definitions: amount of money spent on something; cost
examples: Travel expenses will be reimbursed by the company
We need to cut our monthly expenses significantly

definitions: thick white or pale yellow fatty liquid from milk
thick smooth substance applied to skin
examples: Add cream to the coffee for a richer taste
The recipe calls for heavy cream and butter
Apply the face cream before going to bed
This hand cream helps with dry skin

definitions: state of being exposed to view or made known
being subjected to harmful conditions or substances
examples: The scandal led to media exposure of corruption
His exposure to different cultures broadened his perspective
Prolonged exposure to sun can damage your skin
Workers complained about exposure to dangerous chemicals

definitions: something that is considered more important than other matters
examples: Family health is our top priority this year
The manager explained the project priorities clearly

definitions: upper layer of earth where plants grow
examples: The soil here is perfect for growing vegetables
Rich, dark soil filled the garden beds

definitions: spiritual being believed to act as God's messenger
person who is very kind, helpful, or beautiful
examples: The painting depicted angels with golden wings
Many religions describe angels as divine messengers
The nurse was an absolute angel during recovery
Thank you for helping; you're such an angel

definitions: act of traveling from one place to another, especially over a long distance
examples: Their journey across the country took three weeks
The journey by train offers beautiful mountain views

definitions: firm belief in reliability, truth, or ability of someone or something
legal arrangement managing property or money for someone
examples: Building trust takes time but losing it happens quickly
She put complete trust in her doctor's advice
The inheritance was placed in a trust fund
He manages several family trusts for clients

definitions: large container for holding liquid or gas
heavy armored fighting vehicle with tracks
examples: The water tank holds five hundred gallons
Fill the gas tank before the long trip
Army tanks rolled through the city streets
The museum displays a World War Two tank

definitions: food made from pressed milk curds
examples: The sandwich needs more cheese to taste better
This store sells cheese from around the world

definitions: plan that lists times when events or activities will happen
examples: Check the train schedule before leaving home
Her work schedule changes every two weeks

definitions: room used for sleeping in a house or apartment
examples: The master bedroom has an attached bathroom
Children should clean their bedrooms every week

definitions: quality of sound, especially of voice or musical instrument
general character, attitude, or feeling of something
examples: Her tone of voice suggested she was upset
The violin has a warm, rich tone
The meeting had a serious, professional tone throughout
The article's tone was critical but fair

definitions: process of carefully choosing someone or something
collection of things chosen from a larger group
examples: The selection process for the job took weeks
Natural selection drives evolution in living organisms
The store offers a wide selection of wines
This selection of poems represents her best work

definitions: circular object that rotates on an axle, used for movement or machinery
examples: The front wheel of my bicycle needs repair
Ancient civilizations invented the wheel for transportation

definitions: empty space or opening between two things
difference in level or amount between things
examples: A small gap between the fence boards lets light through
Mind the gap when boarding the subway train
The wage gap between workers continues to grow
There's a significant gap in test scores

definitions: person who has served in the armed forces
person with long experience in a particular field
examples: The veterans gathered for the memorial service
Many veterans need support transitioning to civilian life
She's a veteran teacher with thirty years experience
The veteran actor has appeared in countless films

definitions: typical quality or feature that makes someone or something recognizable
examples: Patience is an important characteristic for teachers
The bird's red crest is its most obvious characteristic

definitions: substance found in food that is necessary for body growth and repair
examples: Meat and beans are excellent sources of protein
Athletes need extra protein for muscle recovery

definitions: firm decision to do or not do something
degree of detail visible in an image or display
examples: Her New Year's resolution was to exercise daily
The board passed a resolution supporting the proposal
This monitor offers high resolution for gaming
Increase the image resolution for better print quality

definitions: entire thing with all its parts; complete amount
examples: She ate the whole pizza by herself
The whole class participated in the science project

definitions: person who designs, builds, or maintains engines, machines, or structures
examples: The engineer designed a more efficient bridge structure
Software engineers develop applications for smartphones

definitions: act of moving on foot at moderate speed
path designed for walking
examples: A daily walk improves both physical and mental health
Let's take a walk around the neighborhood together
The garden walk leads to a small fountain
Clear the snow from the front walk please

definitions: shallow container for holding or serving food
particular type of prepared food
examples: Put the dirty dishes in the dishwasher
These ceramic dishes are microwave safe
Pasta is her favorite dish to cook
The restaurant's signature dish uses local ingredients

definitions: unwanted or unusable material; garbage
use of something in a careless or unnecessary way
examples: Separate organic waste from recyclable materials
The factory produces tons of industrial waste
Don't waste water during the drought
That meeting was a complete waste of time

definitions: text or images produced by printing
design or pattern applied to fabric or surface
examples: The print in this book is too small
Check the fine print before signing
Her dress has a beautiful floral print
Animal prints are popular this season

definitions: medical condition causing persistent sadness and loss of interest
area that is lower than the surrounding surface
examples: Treatment for depression often includes therapy and medication
Many people experience depression during winter months
Rain collected in the depression near the road
The geographic depression forms a natural basin

definitions: informal word for a man or person
examples: That dude over there is my neighbor
Hey dude, can you help me move this?

definitions: thing given to someone as a gift
period of time happening now
examples: She wrapped the birthday present in colorful paper
The children opened their presents on Christmas morning
Let's focus on the present rather than the past
At present, we have no plans to expand

definitions: chief executive officer; highest-ranking person in a company
examples: The CEO announced record profits this quarter
She became CEO after twenty years with the company

definitions: new plan or process to achieve something
ability to act independently and make decisions
examples: The government launched an initiative to reduce poverty
This environmental initiative aims to plant more trees
Employees who show initiative often get promoted faster
Taking initiative demonstrates leadership potential

definitions: movable barrier used to close an opening in a fence or wall
examples: Close the garden gate to keep the dog inside
Security checked passes at the main gate

definitions: act of going into or coming into a place
item written or recorded in a list, diary, or database
examples: Entry to the museum requires a valid ticket
The guard denied entry without proper identification
Each journal entry describes her daily experiences
Check the dictionary entry for pronunciation guide

definitions: act of helping someone or providing support
examples: Thank you for your assistance with this project
The store offers assistance to elderly customers
